Title: Starmer must account for his government's actions on winter fuel - Welsh FM
Description: Keir Starmer has to account for his government's decision to cut the winter fuel allowance for millions of pensioners, Wales's first minister has said.

Title: Five unanswered questions about the apparent assassination attempt on Trump
Description: The suspect in an apparent assassination attempt against Donald Trump over the weekend has been charged with two federal gun crimes.

Title: Girl, 8, found safe after taking mum's car for 11 mile drive to shop
Description: An eight-year-old girl has returned home safe after driving her mother's car to a discount store more than 11 miles away while her family and police searched for her.

Title: Commonwealth Games set to return to Glasgow in 2026
Description: The Commonwealth Games are set to return to Glasgow in 2026.

Title: How the assassination attempt on Trump is affecting US election bets and polls
Description: In any other race, an assassination attempt on a candidate would have been the most dramatic and potentially game-changing event.

Title: Plans for Welsh parliament gender quotas scrapped
Description: Plans to introduce gender quotas in the Welsh parliament have been scrapped.

Title: Meta bans Russian state media networks from Facebook and Instagram over 'foreign interference'
Description: Instagram and Facebook owner Meta is banning RT and other Russian state media networks from its platforms over claims they carried out covert operations to influence social media users.

Title: White House hits out at 'irresponsible' Musk over assassination comments
Description: The White House has called Elon Musk 'irresponsible' after he posted on social media that 'no one is even trying' to assassinate Joe Biden or Kamala Harris.

Title: Man accused of drugging his wife and letting 50 men rape her admits crimes
Description: A man accused of drugging his wife and letting at least 50 men rape her while she was sedated has told a French court: 'I am a rapist.'

Title: Thousands of Gaza amputees to get rapid prosthetic limbs using UK tech
Description: A Jordanian-led programme to help fit prosthetic limbs to thousands of victims of the Gaza war has begun.

Title: PM 'angry' to see prisoners popping champagne after their early release
Description: Sir Keir Starmer has said he was 'angry' to learn that offenders were being greeted with champagne outside of prison gates after being released early to ease overcrowding.

Title: Amazon tells staff to get back to the office five days a week
Description: Amazon has told its office workers they may no longer work from home except in extenuating circumstances.

Title: Trump describes scene in apparent shooting attempt - as new details emerge
Description: Donald Trump has described being grabbed by Secret Service agents after 'four or five' gunshots were heard during an apparent assassination attempt while he played golf.

Title: Beauty queen challenges pageant rules disqualifying mothers
Description: A budding beauty queen is challenging the rules of the Miss America and Miss World pageants that she claims disqualify mothers from competing.

Title: Climate action will be central to 'all' foreign policy, David Lammy says
Description: Climate action will be central to 'all' foreign policy, David Lammy has said as the new government seeks to rebrand the UK's international image.

Title: Davey to say Lib Dems will offer people hope - and will accuse Tories of being 'unfit for opposition'
Description: Sir Ed Davey is to say his party will offer people hope and will accuse the Conservatives of being 'unfit for opposition'.

Title: At least 16 killed in flooding across eastern and central Europe
Description: At least 16 people have died after heavy flooding across eastern and central Europe.

Title: Government diverts up to £75m from scrapped Rwanda plan to 'autumn crime crackdown'
Description: The government has diverted up to £75m from the scrapped Rwanda plan to fund the new Border Security Command ahead of an immigration 'crime crackdown'.

Title: The three mpox scenarios the UK is preparing for
Description: The UK government has procured 150,000 doses of additional mpox vaccine in preparation for anticipated cases of a new potentially deadlier strain causing a growing outbreak in Africa and isolated cases in Europe and Asia detected in recent weeks.

Title: One of final messages from Titan submersible revealed in hearing
Description: One of the final messages from the Titan submersible crew said they were 'all good here' before it imploded, killing all five on board.

Title: Junior doctors in England vote to accept pay deal
Description: Junior doctors in England have voted to accept a government pay offer worth an extra 22.3% on average over two years.

Title: Starmer seeks urgent fix over small boat crossings during controversial Italy trip
Description: The return of British pragmatism' - these were the words from the prime minister's press conference on Monday.

Title: People 'stomped' to death in migrant boat crush, says survivor who saw son die
Description: A man has said his son and seven others died after being 'stomped on' in a packed migrant boat as people became trapped just minutes into the journey.

Title: PM promises 'pragmatism' on small boats amid hints government could follow Italy's Albania plan
Description: The prime minister has said the UK has moved 'from a government of gimmicks to a government of pragmatism' as he attempts to tackle the small boat crisis.

Title: MP was told she was four days from death
Description: Liberal Democrat deputy leader Daisy Cooper has revealed she was told she had four days to live but the NHS saved her.

Title: PM says it is 'important rules are followed' after clothes donation row
Description: The prime minister has said it is 'very important... that the rules are followed' after becoming embroiled in a row about a donor paying for his wife's clothes.

Title: Dozens of Hezbollah members 'seriously hurt by exploding pagers'
Description: Dozens of members of the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah have been seriously wounded after pagers they use to communicate exploded, security officials say.
